citation.article-title: Pedobacter koreensis sp. nov., isolated from fresh water
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pedobacter koreensis sp. nov.
Pedobacter koreensis (ko.re.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. koreensis pertaining to Korea, from where the organism was isolated).
Cells are rod-shaped, Gram-negative, motile, aerobic bacteria.
Best growth is observed on media such as TSA, plate count agar and R2A, but grows only weakly on nutrient agar.
Does not grow on MacConkey agar.
Colonies on TSA agar are translucent, low-convex, circular, smooth, wet, slimy and approximately 3.0 mm in diameter after 5 days incubation at 25 °C (pH 7).
Growth occurs in 0–2 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 0 %).
Growth occurs at pH 6–11 (optimum, pH 7) and at 4–37 °C (optimum, 25 °C).
Oxidase- and catalase-positive.
Does not produce H2S or acetoin.
Produces N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, aesculin hydrolase, leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and valine arylamidase.
Does not produce α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase, ornithine decarboxylase or trypsin.
Utilizes the following substrates as sole carbon and energy sources: arabinose, β-gentiobiose and maltose.

Does not utilize the following substrates: d-arabitol, l-arabitol, arbutin, erythritol, aesculin, d-fucose, l-fucose, mannitol, melezitose, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, d-turanose, d-tagatose, adipate, caprate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate and phenylacetate.

Sensitive to the following antibiotics (μg per disc, unless otherwise indicated): cefotaxime (30), chloramphenicol (30), ciprofloxacin (5), gentamicin (10), imipenem (10), isepamicin (30), lincomycin (2), novobiocin (30), piperacillin (100), rifampicin (5), tetracycline (30), teicoplanin (30) and vancomycin (30).

Resistant to the following antibiotics (μg per disc, unless otherwise indicated): amikacin (30), ampicillin (10), aztreonam (30), bacitracin (10 U), cefepime (30), cefmetazole (30), ceftazidime (30), moxalactam (30), oxacillin (1), penicillin (10 U), streptomycin (100) and tobramycin (10).
Other physiological and biochemical characteristics are given in Table 1.
Major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c (29.7 %), iso-C15 : 0 (26.4 %) and iso-C17 : 1 3-OH (10.1 %); the complete fatty acid content is given in Table 2.
The DNA G+C content is 38.0 mol%.
The type strain, WPCB189T (=KCTC 12536T=NBRC 101153T), was isolated from fresh water from the Woopo wetland, Republic of Korea.
